attributes.action: Make dentistry free at the point of delivery for all and fees payable later
attributes.background: The NHS dental services in England are a shambles. There is no free at the point of delivery service for patients in need of treatment who don't fall into the low earnings category. I am petitioning to make all UK NHS dentistry free at point of delivery giving everyone a chance to access it.
attributes.additional_details:
Payment would then be made at a later date. It would mean no one would have to suffer. We don't fall into the low income bracket but we also cannot afford dentistry on the spot. My practice doesn't even do emergency slots. I'm sat here with a hole in one of my molars, the pain of the exposed nerve is worse than childbirth yet there's no way I'll be able to get treatment within the next month.
The whole point of paying national insurance and tax is to guarantee our healthcare!

attributes.action: Remove fees for basic RGN nurse training and teach them in nursing schools.
attributes.background:
The NHS is unable to recruit sufficient nurses and many potential nurses are put off by university / diploma debts. 
Increase the student nurse uptake by paying a basic salary and contract them to work for the trust that trained them for 6 months once qualified.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the schools of nursing were removed from our teaching hospitals the number of people coming into nursing has declined. In 1990 student nurses made up a THIRD of the NHS workforce, once Project 2000 was introduced the quality and number of student nurses steadily slipped.
Nursing at degree level entry means the NHS has lost thousands of potentially fabulous nurses because those that want to nurse cannot afford to train. 
We need excellent basic nursing care skills before we need a degree!

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to declare allergenic ingredients in alcoholic distillates
attributes.background: By law, allergens on ingredients lists must be highlighted by means including bold type, italics, underlining - anything that emphasises the presence of 1 of the 14 allergens. Alcoholic distillates are exempt from this law and do not have to declare the allergenic ingredients - a danger to many.
attributes.additional_details: I bought my boyfriend some chocolates for Valentine's from a well-known chocolate shop. He has a severe nut allergy and has been hospitalised before. I checked the ingredients many times and asked staff to check - nuts weren't listed as an allergen. On opening the chocolates, one contained hazelnut liqueur - which by law doesn't have to be declared as an allergen. This is dangerous, and could have killed my boyfriend. Action needs to be taken so derived products also have to declare allergens.

attributes.action: For the campaign #askforangela to be a government backed national roll out
attributes.background: A simple code-word campaign for people feeling unsafe on a date. It encourages people to discreetly ask for help by going to the bar and ' Ask for Angela' - a phrase aimed at alerting bar staff to the cry for help so they can help defuse the situation discretely and without fuss.
attributes.additional_details:
A woman has successfully used the ‘Ask for Angela’ safety scheme to remove herself from a difficult situation during a night out.

A number of pubs across the country offer the scheme, which aims to reduce sexual violence and vulnerability by providing men and women with a subtle phrase they can use to get out of uncomfortable or potentially dangerous circumstances.

One pub in Gloucester successfully helped a female patron to do just that.

attributes.action: Convert the EU Charter of Rights into UK law
attributes.background: The Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union is important to everybody. It gives people a voice to be heard. The Charter of Rights needs to be converted into UK law after leaving EU so that our rights as humans are fully protected both at home and abroad.
attributes.additional_details: EU Charter of Rights gives access to proper justice and proper freedom for all without partiality. The UK has had a good history on human rights and protection for its citizens both at home and abroad.

attributes.action: Encourage Banks to form a marketplace in our communities for general services.
attributes.background: Banks need to consider how best to meet the continuing needs of households and businesses alike. There should be a marketplace in our towns where Banks can maintain a presence together which would be beneficial to those customers who prefer or need a face to face service.
attributes.additional_details: The Financial Conduct Authority have already logged my comments on this matter and will consider it in their on going regulation of the banking markets. The infirm/disabled, those lacking confidence on line, those with poor broadband provision or requiring to bank coin; cannot be done at any mobile banking alternative. All of these will be severely impacted upon should the trend of Bank closures continue.

attributes.action: Make the waiting lists for NHS gender identity clinics shorter
attributes.background: I’m a trans young person with mental health difficulties & I’m currently on a 2 year waiting list for a gender identity clinic. I feel like this waiting time is detrimental to my mental health difficulties & the long waiting time isn’t fair on myself or other trans people experiencing the same thing
attributes.additional_details: Long waiting times for specialist treatment can not only cause someone with gender dysphoria to go downhill, but it can be so frustrating and upsetting for trans people and their families. It takes a lot of courage to come out as trans and the long waiting times make us feel unimportant. Feeling as if you’re in the wrong body and being so desperate to change is really challenging and I feel like we should be able access support sooner.

attributes.action: Increase Funding for Existing Youth Clubs and Open New Youth Clubs Across the UK
attributes.background: Violent crime has increased across the UK for reasons that trace back to a lack of funding. There are less places for our youth to go and socialise with people their own age in a controlled safe environment outside school hours in deprived areas. The boredom and distrust has encouraged more violence

attributes.action: Create a new minimum wage called the Qualified minimum wage.
attributes.background: When a person is trained or qualified to do a job, they should automatically qualify for the qualified minimum wage (in line with the age group)  which is a higher rate to recognise the skill.
attributes.additional_details:
I understand that at the moment there is no national recognised wage for a qualified person. Therefore there is no incentive to invest in training or learning a trade. 
Weather you are a nurse, plumber, driver, dental nurse or brick layer. Skills should be recognised.

attributes.action: Make it unlawful for buses to carry standing children on the motorway.
attributes.background: There is an anomoly in the law in that children are required to use car seats until the age of 12 and everyone must wear seatbelts in vehicles save for a few exceptions, yet apparently double decker buses can be licensed to carry up to 30 standing passengers on the motorway even if they are children
attributes.additional_details: My child uses a double decker school bus which has to travel on the motorway to avoid a low bridge. There are insufficient seats for the children so there are always children standing. I have raised this with various Govt agencies and Bus Users UK advised that buses can be licensed to carry up to 30 children standing because of economics. Even if they change the route to rectify our situation it seems insane that any child in the UK could be placed at risk in this manner on our busy motorways.

attributes.action: Abolish stamp duty for first time buyers
attributes.background: For the government to recognise the great difficulty experienced by first time buyers to find thousands of pounds of stamp duty while also having to raise very large deposits in order to get on the property ladder and therefore for the government to alleviate this expense by waiving SDLT for FTBs.

attributes.action: Include Paediatric First Aid Training in the ante-natal classes for new parents
attributes.background: There have been many situations where trained parents have saved their babies life but there’s also one to many cases where a baby has been lost because parents were lost in despair not knowing to take action. Knowing CPR is critical and all new parents should know how to save the baby if needed be.
attributes.additional_details: Many parents have taken their sad stories to social media to warn other parents of potential risks and advised them to take a CPR course

attributes.action: Change the legal driving age to 16
attributes.background: At 16, you can get married and have children, drive a motor bike but you can’t drive a car, this is unfair.

attributes.action: Ban all plastic shopping bags and instead only sell reusable shopping bags.
attributes.background: The impact of plastic bags on the environment is enormous. ... Approximately 100,000 sea turtles and other marine animals die every year because they either mistake the bags for food or get strangled in them, says Natural.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2017/nov/03/dramatic-rise-in-plastic-seabed-litter-around-uk
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/greenerideal.com/news/environment/0613-how-do-plastic-bags-affect-our-environment/amp/

attributes.action: Make sending unsolicited pictures of penises illegal
attributes.background: Women are being sent many unwanted photographs of penises, it is just as distressing as in the flesh which is already covered by indecent exposure laws.
attributes.additional_details: We need everyone to know that an unwanted penis is unwanted whether it is in the flesh or in a photograph. You should have a communication trail to prove it was wanted.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for 2 people to travel on a Moped.
attributes.background:
I want to change the law to stop 2 people travelling on a Moped. 
The reason for this is to stop Criminal Offences including Acid attacks, Mobile phone snatching, Handbag snatching etc...
This will not affect Motorbike riders.
attributes.additional_details:
As we have seen on the News headlines these crimes are often carried out by 2 people on a Moped where the passenger is spraying Acid or snatching personal items from pedestrians. This will allow the Police to stop, search and charge these criminals before they commit these serious offences.
This Law will not affect Motorbike riders who are generally older and using Motorbikes for genuine travelling.

attributes.action: Make sure every disabled toilet uses the radar key.Ban selling radar keys online
attributes.background: Not all disabled toilets have a radar lock so I couldn't use my radar key. Most disabled people carry a radar key to make them independent. Also, did you know that anyone can buy a radar key online? It's defeating the purpose of it. It should be only available to disabled people.

attributes.action: Fund free vet care for people who can't afford it
attributes.background: I feel that hospitals are charging people a lot of money for pet care, some people can't afford. I lost my beloved pet who I consider to be my child because of the high costs of treatment.
attributes.additional_details: My pet was suffering from meningitis.

attributes.action: Introduce a system for immigration to the UK like Australia based on work skills
attributes.background: To enter Austrailia to live you must apply and are considered based on the contribution you can make to the country. Each applicant should be able and expected to work and priority is given to applicants who are qualified in emplyment areas which we are lacking applicants

attributes.action: Cap Insurance Prices For People Under 25.
attributes.background: Insurance prices for young drivers is too high, often being in the thousands for a car that will only cost a few hundred pounds. Similar petitions have been started in the past but this one is different as I propose that a power cap is put on cars.
attributes.additional_details: My idea is to introduce a similar system to motorcycles and limit the power of cars young people can drive for 3 years after passing their test. A limit of 1600cc, this lowers the power that a young driver can have therefore meaning that they cannot have a car that is too powerful for them to control, insurance companies can then cap out insurance making it lower for all people as there are less powerful cars being driven by young drivers, making the roads safer for everyone in turn too.

attributes.action: NHS need to invest more money in Adult Mental Health and Psychiatric hospitals.
attributes.background: Mental Health and Psychiatric hospitals
attributes.additional_details: The NHS do not provide adequate staff and there are very few things to do on Adult Psychiatric wards. Staff need to be trained properly to deal with situations they do not know how to. There needs to be more distractions and activities to do and more staffing to ensure there are people to talk to when needed.

attributes.action: Make ear piercing in under 10s illegal.
attributes.background: I strongly believe that no child should be forced to have holes punctured in to their skin until they are old enough to understand what is involved.
attributes.additional_details: If you made a hole like that in any other part of a baby/child, you would have them taken away. Just because it has a gem in it, it's different? People say “It's better to get them done when they're little because they don't remember it”... It's not compulsory.

attributes.action: The Government make immediate preparations and employ more border personnel
attributes.background: That the Government must not delay any longer and must immediately hire more personnel, for customs and border security and be ready for brexit in March 2019. We were promised contol of our borders yet so far we have not seen evidence that any preparation has been made

attributes.action: Make St. George's Day, 23rd April, a Public Holiday
attributes.background: St. Patrick's Day is a public holiday in Northern Ireland, why shouldn't the English celebrate their Patron Saint's Day with a Public Holiday?

attributes.action: To facilitate doctors entry into the Obs & Gyn training at ST3+ level
attributes.background: Non trainee doctors, contribute significantly to the provision of healthcare in the NHS. They are often overlooked when it comes to training opportunities, therefore unable to progress in their careers and are left disillusioned, frustrated and disappointed.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently many specialities allow entry to the training at middle grade (ST3+level) except in speciality of Obstetrics and Gynaecology, which only allows entry at ST1 level.
Although there is a noticeable dropout rate of 40% of the trainees from ST1 level onwards, which impacts on the middle grade rota, as there is no recruitment for the trainees at this level, this has created significant difficulties in providing safe Obs and Gyn services. We request that the RCOG and Department of Health to create ST3+ level entry for training in Obs and Gyn . This will help to cover the middle grade rota gaps thus ensuring safe obstetric service in UK and allow  Non training grade doctors to fulfil their career ambitions. Overall, this will prevent the loss of highly skilled doctors from the NHS.

attributes.action: A wider range of physical education must be taught in schools
attributes.background: The government has been encouraging sport to combat obesity for years but if children do not enjoy the sports which they are taught then they may decide that they do not enjoy sport at all and refrain from exercising in the future.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently the law dictates that children must be taught athletics, dance, gymnastics, swimming and games but there is no specific rules about which 'games' must be played.

If children are given a more extensive range of sports, such as water polo, they may find a passion for sport that they would never have discovered otherwise.

attributes.action: Make Eid a national holiday
attributes.background: Muslims believe that Eid should be a national holiday as it is a religious celebration similar to Christmas. Many people believe this from Muslims to even none Muslims.

attributes.action: Britisher should have right to make/change laws through referendum like Swiss.
attributes.background: This is the real idea about real Democracy. Through this process Swiss State have provided rights for public and opportunity to have a say in decision making to change or to make new laws for Swiss nation.
attributes.additional_details:
In Switzerland general people can make new laws and could make constitutional amendments through a referendum . If anyone would like to make new law or would like to make any constitutional amendment in Switzerland ; he/she or group of people should get 100,000 signatures to support their proposal .

Please see Swiss Constitution.

attributes.action: Bring the limit to claim for unfair dismissal down from 2 years to 12 months
attributes.background: This petition is to bring the limit in taking their employer to a tribunal for unfair or constructive dismissal which you don't have much chance if you have to be there for more than 2 years, if we can get it dropped to 12 months it may give people in the work place a better chance financially!
attributes.additional_details: You must have worked for your employer for a minimum period before you qualify for the right to claim unfair dismissal at a tribunal. If you're classed as an employee and started your job on or after 6 April 2012 - the qualifying period is normally 2 years. It should be dropped to 12 months to give people a bit more security in work and to stop employers getting rid of employees under ridiculous excuses and giving the employees a leg to stand on!

attributes.action: Make scoliosis screening compulsory in all UK schools
attributes.background: It is estimated 4 out of every 1000 children in the UK have scoliosis.  Once a curve reaches 40 degrees, spinal fusion surgery is the only option for treatment. Introducing a screening program into schools would reduce the number of patients undergoing major, invasive, life changing surgery.
attributes.additional_details: Around half of US States have compulsory screening in schools, the program is FREE other than a small cost to train a member of staff to be able to carry out the basic "Forward Bend" test. This is a simple solution to a massive, and growing, problem in our society. By catching scoliosis early, the options for treatment is wider and the life of the affected child would be less impacted. The overall cost on the NHS would be lower as each operation for the surgery alone costs in excess of £10,000.

attributes.action: Add the topic of eating disorders to the national PSHE curriculum
attributes.background: In the UK, 1.6 million people suffer from an eating disorder. This is an issue that often affects students, especially teenagers from 14-25. We believe that is often not talked about so to raise awareness and break the stigma we want it to be added to the national PSHE curriculum.
attributes.additional_details:
6.4% of Adults displayed evidence of having an eating disorder. 
Children as young as 6 have been known to have an eating disorder.
Being able to spot the symptoms in a friend or family member is extremely important and with growing numbers of eating disorders in the UK, it is essential to equip the youth with the right knowledge.

LEARN MORE: 
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/eating-disorders/
https://www.mind.org.uk/information-support/types-of-mental-health-problems/eating-problems/

attributes.action: Invest more in the NHS to prevent it from being at breaking point
attributes.background: The NHS has been underfunded for years. The government has failed to address this issue. They claim that the NHS is working better than it ever has yet patient and left in hospital corridors for hours with out a bed!
attributes.additional_details: The NHS is facing the worst winter in its 70 year history. They are seeing more people than ever before. As a results all hospitals in England have cancelled all routine operations and appointments so staff can help in A&E departments. Many hospitals have declared critical alert the highest level because of the unprecedented demand on the services. The government is saying there is nothing wrong and the NHS is operating normally! The NHS desperately needs emergency crash push to help recover.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on the UK abolishing the Monarchy and becoming a Republic
attributes.background: A Monarchy that receives taxpayers' money is an anachronism in a modern democracy. A referendum should be held to ascertain whether the British people are prepared to continue to pay for this archaic institution.

attributes.action: Stop the closure of Dagenham Jobcentre
attributes.background:
Dagenham Jobcentre is set to close on 19th January 2018, as part of a program of closures of Jobcentres across the country.
Dagenham residents will struggle to get to Barking Jobcentre.
Residents will risk having payments stopped through sanctions, being forced into debt and destitution.
attributes.additional_details:
Universal credit is too complicated particularly for vulnerable people such as those with mental health issues.
People struggling with the online access risk having their money stopped through sanctions.
Over one million low-paid workers will also be drawn into the new system and could face sanctions if they don’t prove they are applying for better paid work.
Residents in Dagenham NEED a jobcentre in order to be able to cope with the chaos caused by the implementation of Universal Credit.

attributes.action: Add a limit to the maximum amount of persons allowed on a commercial train.
attributes.background:
Trains in the UK (especially in the North) are overcrowded with the companies regularly citing new trains coming and a lack thereof as a reason for such poor service. 
People are crammed in like cattle and are forced to stand within less than 30 cm of each other every day. No H/S limit is enforced.
attributes.additional_details:
You only need to commute on one in the morning to see this problem occur. Stations get missed, companies charge exuberant prices, people get crushed, people overheat (no air con on a lot of trains) and nothing is being done about it.

An office has a maximum limit to the persons allowed on a Health and Safety grounds, as do many other businesses and services (bus's do too). Why not trains?

attributes.action: Advise the Queen to make the London Borough of Richmond a Royal Borough
attributes.background: Richmond has two existing Royal Palaces (Hampton Court & Kew Palace) and a rich history of Royal connections, patronage and places. No borough deserves Royal status more than Richmond.
attributes.additional_details: I wrote to the Secretary of State few years ago asking for Royal Borough status for Richmond and it was politely declined in favour of Greenwich. It's time to ask again via this petition.

attributes.action: To Put Mental Health medication on to the exemption list for a free prescription
attributes.background: I have been on Bipolar Medication for a while. Like others who have various mental health problems, I can't get it for free as it is not on the exemption list. However I am on this medication for the rest of my life. It should be on the list because like most medications on the list, it's for life.
attributes.additional_details: Most people I know on these medications can't get it for free and have to pay £8.70 just for the medication, however people with thyroid problems and other problems can get it for free and all their other medications for free! Why when this is a condition that we must have our tablets every day otherwise become very ill and put into hospital can we not get it? This is an issue that needs to be spoken about mental health has to be spoken up about. It's difficult going through this and getting help.

attributes.action: Make safe standing zones a legal requirement for English Football league clubs.
attributes.background: To prevent clubs from forcing passionate season ticket holders to remain seated during matches, and to promote a positive atmosphere for supporters.

attributes.action: The Government should ensure women are fully represented across the curriculum.
attributes.background: In the centenary year since the passing of Representation of People Act which enabled women over 30 with property to vote, it seems fitting that the women’s struggle for equality and equity should be featured across the curriculum as should women’s achievements which are under represented

attributes.action: Stop disabled  badge users parking on double yellows
attributes.background: Stop disabled badge users parking on double yellows and causing an obstruction to service, delivery and emergency service vehicles

attributes.action: To make it compulsory to make midwives check for CHD's in new baby home visits.
attributes.background:
My brother was born with an unknown CHD. My mum was unaware of any of this as no-one picked it up.
Now my brother has to have invasive surgeries all his life.
Many babies go home without knowing they  are very I'll. I want to change that please sign this so more babies beat these horrible diseases
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS do not disclose that they are looking for CHD's in 5 month scan, nor do they spefically look after birth.
This I think needs to be changed midwives should carry guidelines for this and oximeters to potiantally save a baby. 
Too many babies die from these illnesses.
I have seen this first hand.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for local councils to scan deceased domestic animals
attributes.background: Make it a legal requirement for local councils to scan deceased domestic animals for chips and report to local vet to alert owners, to ensure people are aware their pet has passed away and don’t continue looking, also to raise awareness of potential animal abuse in certain boroughs
attributes.additional_details: Local council are collecting cats and dogs found and just disposing of them with other waste without any form of logging system this leads to people often looking for pets months and even years putting up flyers for animals they have no hope of finding. To support people and boroughs in identifying potential animal cruelty occurring within a borough who has excessive number of missing domesticated pets

attributes.action: UK government to recognise East Jerusalem as the capital of Palestine.
attributes.background: In response to the action taken by the US president Donald Trump the UK government should recognise East Jerusalem as the capital of Palestine. This would help with the 2 state peace solution and take away the negativity of the actions taken by the USA.

attributes.action: Make it impossible to claim benefits totalling more than the minimum wage
attributes.background:
Nobody on benefits should be able to claim more money per month than a person working full time in a minimum wage job.

How do we expect people to find work if they would be worse off working than on benefits.

Exceptions to this rule should only be made to disabled and elderly people.

attributes.action: Make it an Offence Outside London to Park on Footpaths.
attributes.background: More and More Drivers are using the Footpaths to Park on, this causes a number of issue such as No consideration for the Disabled/Blind and Pushchairs where Children could run into the road, plus Damage being caused to the Footpaths due to them Not being made for Vehicles costing Money to repair.
attributes.additional_details: Very often people on Foot with Pushchairs and Disabled Scooters can Not get through which causes a Safety issue with people having to go out into the road with children in some cases, Footpaths as in the name are for people on Foot and Disabled Scooters, the Councils have to pay good Money in Repairs where they are not re enforced, this come go elsewhere to needed causes, many Drivers are just Lazy these days, London should Not be the Only place that Banned them, Not Equal and Wrong.

attributes.action: Stop funding political parties that dont take their seats in Parliament.
attributes.background: This petition is for the Government to stop funding abstentionist parties who fail to take they're seats in Parliament, and for that money to be redistributed to frontline health services.

attributes.action: Free NHS prescriptions for full time students.
attributes.background: The university students are unable to pay for their prescriptions as they can't work because of the full time education.

attributes.action: Stop MLM distributors selling health and weight loss products without training
attributes.background: Products like weight loss teas, meal replacements and other supplements are currently being sold by multi-level marketing distributors who aren't required to have any formal training in nutrition. They are giving advice that they aren't qualified to give and this is dangerous to the general public.
attributes.additional_details:
Multi-level marketing distributors can mislead the general public with promises of fast weight loss and cures for ailments, without informing them of the risks to their health or the side effects. This ignores the duty of care which qualified individuals (dieticians) have to adhere to by law.

By forcing the MLM Company to educate the distributors, the duty of care is passed to the distributors who can be regulated to make sure the clients are assessed with proper screening.

attributes.action: Make it statutory requirement for schools to consult parents about GCSE re-marks
attributes.background: Pupil failed GCSE by 1 mark. School said exam sent for re-mark. Without parent consultation, school only requested 1 component of exam be re-marked. We assumed whole exam was re-marked and would have requested this if had been asked. Extra mark not found & deadlines closed to get other paper marked.
attributes.additional_details: Schools are making decisions about GCSE re-marks without consulting parents as the JCQ Guidance does not state they must consult parents in decisions. In this case the School negligently sent a component for a re-mark that had met the grade boundary for a pass and did not send the component that needed 1 more mark for a pass despite this component being worth 60% of the mark. Exam board have confirmed that there were more marks on the unsent component. School should have sent both to find 1 mark

attributes.action: To make parole board members directly culpable for the actions of those released
attributes.background: A new law is required. Parole board experts release convicts who then go on to re-offend. The public get assaulted and maimed, the experts on the parole board hide in their anonymity. If a convict is paroled and murders, then every member of that board should serve the sentence with their convict.
attributes.additional_details:
Parole boards are only accountable to themselves, not to the public. One of these is about to release "The Black Cab Rapist" after 10 years of an indeterminate sentence. This could make the public unsafe.
 
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-42571219
